definition: lit. wind past your ear/fig. sth you don't pay much attention to/in one ear and out the other
ear/handle (archaeology)/and that is all (Classical Chinese)
side/edge/margin/border/boundary/CL:個|个[ge4]/simultaneously
suffix of a noun of locality
wind/news/style/custom/manner/CL:陣|阵[zhen4],絲|丝[si1]
lit. to treat (what sb says) as wind past your ear/fig. to completely disregard

sentences.english: He takes his parents' advice as a breeze passing by.
sentences.chinese: 他將父母親的話當耳邊風。

sentences.english: Everything I told him seemed to go in one ear and out the other.
sentences.chinese: 我告訴他的每件事他好像都當成耳邊風一樣。

sentences.english: Don't throw my warnings to the wind.
sentences.chinese: 別把我的勸告當耳邊風。

sentences.english: Why will you always turn a deaf ear to what I tell you?
sentences.chinese: 我給你講的話，你怎麼老當作耳邊風？

sentences.english: Dares ours speech to work as neglected advice?
sentences.chinese: 敢把我們的話當耳邊風？

sentences.english: To the seasoned campaigner, the remarks of hecklers were like water off a duck's back.
sentences.chinese: 對老練的競選者來說，質問者的話有如耳邊風。

sentences.english: My repeated warnings to her went in one ear and out the other.
sentences.chinese: 她把我對她的一再警告當作耳邊風。

sentences.english: He took my words like a passing wind.
Everything I tell them just goes in one ear and out the other.
sentences.chinese: 我無論對他們說什麼都只被當作耳邊風。

sentences.english: The thing that really annoys me is that he did not take my words seriously.
sentences.chinese: 他把我的話當耳邊風，這實在令我生氣。

sentences.english: What you did to make your brother tune you out.
sentences.chinese: 你究竟做了什麼才使得你弟弟把你的話當耳邊風。

sentences.english: All the criticism seems to have flowed over him.
sentences.chinese: 所有的批評對他似乎都是耳邊風。

sentences.english: Mary: I take it that you chose to ignore your dentist's warning.
sentences.chinese: 我明白了，你把對牙醫的告誡當耳邊風。

sentences.english: Anything we told him went in at one ear and out at the other.
sentences.chinese: 不管我們對他說什麼，他總是當耳邊風。

definition: traitor to one's love/heartless rat
to die without a burial site/to die a pauper/a tragic end
pinyin: si3 wu2 zang4 shen1 zhi1 di4

definition: the trick of injuring oneself to gain the enemy's confidence/CL:條|条[tiao2]
to take advantage of one's position to bully people (idiom)/to kick people around
equivocal/ambiguous
ability/skill
lit. not even the chickens and dogs are left undisturbed (idiom)/fig. great commotion/pandemonium
lit. as if sitting on pins and needles (idiom)/fig. to be in an uncomfortable situation
stepping stone/fig. person used to advance one's career
without a retreat route/caught in a dead end/having burned one's bridges
to play deaf-mute
clever and eloquent (idiom); fluent/having the gift of the gab
daring/presumptuous/daredevil
lit. the river that divides Chu and Han/fig. a line that divides rival territories/the mid-line between sides on a Chinese chessboard
to go around in circles/to make a detour/(fig.) to beat about the bush
delaying tactics/stalling/measures to stave off an attack/stratagem to win a respite
